forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 59. Southwest wind around 6 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny, with a high near 74. West southwest wind 6 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, residents awaken to a crisp and serene atmosphere, a harbinger of the sunny day ahead. Overnight, the skies have remained mostly clear, with a gentle southwest breeze whispering through the city, creating a comfortable low around 59 degrees. The air bears a freshness typical of late summer, a welcome counterpoint to the sweltering heat that often looms in other parts of the Bay Area at this time of year.

By midday, the sun will cast its golden warmth over the city, nudging temperatures up to a pleasant 74 degrees. Winds from the west southwest will begin to pick up, gently swaying the trees and adding a vibrant energy to the day. While fog may make an occasional appearance, especially near the coast, it can’t overshadow the prevailing clarity that promises stunning vistas of the Golden Gate Bridge and the iconic skyline. Dressing in layers will serve one well; lightweight jackets or cardigans are recommended for the morning chill, giving way to short sleeves as the day warms. The bright weather invites leisurely pursuits—perhaps a stroll along the Embarcadero, where the sea breeze mingles with the hustle and bustle of morning commuters, or an exploration of the vibrant art scene that flourishes in the Mission District. Taking in the sights and sounds of the city, with the promise of an enjoyable day ahead, is sure to lift the spirits and inspire moments of quiet reflection amid the lively urban backdrop.
